admitting_diagnosis: Acute chest pain, rule out myocardial infarction

secondary: Coronary artery disease with 100% occlusion of distal left circumflex and 75% stenosis of RCA, status post PCI with drug-eluting stents

hospital_course: 77-year-old male presented to ED with chest pain radiating to left arm. Initial ECG showed ST depression in inferior and lateral leads. Troponin elevated at 2.5 ng/mL. Patient was taken emergently to cardiac catheterization lab. Coronary angiography revealed 100% occlusion of distal left circumflex and 75% stenosis of RCA. Successful PCI performed with placement of drug-eluting stents to obtuse marginal and RCA. Post-procedure course uncomplicated. Follow-up echocardiogram showed preserved ejection fraction of 60-65% with Grade I diastolic dysfunction. Patient remained hemodynamically stable throughout hospitalization.

procedures_performed.procedure: Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) to obtuse marginal with Onyx 2.0 x 18 mm drug-eluting stent
Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) to RCA with Onyx 3.0 x 22 mm drug-eluting stent

antiplatelet_therapy: Clopidogrel (Plavix) 75 mg daily - DO NOT STOP for at least 12 months

discharge_instructions.activity: Light activity only. No heavy lifting >10 lbs for 1 week. Gradual return to normal activities as tolerated.
discharge_instructions.diet: Cardiac diet - low sodium (<2000mg/day), low fat, heart healthy
discharge_instructions.wound_care: Keep catheter site clean and dry. Watch for signs of infection, bleeding, or hematoma.
follow_up: Cardiology follow-up in 1 week with Dr. McCarty
Primary care follow-up in 2 weeks with NP Katherine Gannon Kiesel
Cardiac rehabilitation - approved for 36 sessions over 12 weeks starting 02/14/2025
discharge_instructions.warning_signs: Return to ED immediately if experiencing chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations, dizziness, or bleeding from catheter site.

patient_education: Patient educated on importance of dual antiplatelet therapy, medication compliance, cardiac diet, regular exercise through cardiac rehab, and recognition of warning signs. Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to treatment plan.
resuscitation_status: DNR/Allow Natural Death per patient wishes
